Empires & Puzzles Mortewitch Review: The Mothmancer of Death

Mortewitch isn't just a sniper; she's an executioner. With an 800% hit that bypasses defenses and a Mega Fiend that amps damage, she deletes heroes while healing her team. Is she the best slow hero in the game?
Mortewitch Review: One Shot, One Kill, Infinite Moths
Mortewitch, The Mothmancer: Death Comes on Gossamer Wings

Mortewitch is a 5-star Legendary Dark (Purple) hero from the Moth family, released in early 2025. As a Sorcerer class hero running at Slow mana speed, she harkens back to the days of "slow but deadly" designs, but with a modern kit that makes the "deadly" part an understatement. She functions primarily as a nuclear sniper—designed to delete a single target from existence while simultaneously providing massive healing to her team based on the violence she inflicts. While the meta often favors speed, Mortewitch makes a compelling argument that if you hit hard enough, speed doesn't matter because there's no one left to retaliate.

The artwork for Mortewitch is a stunning blend of elegance and horror. She features a "pretty little face" masked by moth-like appendages, draped in deep purples and indigos that perfectly match her element. The aesthetic screams "Night of Moths," commanding a swarm with a regal, almost detached demeanor. It is a refreshing departure from standard fantasy tropes, leaning into a more eldritch, insectoid beauty. You might want to pet the moth, but remember: it eats clothes, and in this case, it eats health bars.

With a base power of 1178 and an Attack stat pushing nearly 1200 (before Limit Breaks), Mortewitch sits comfortably in the upper echelon of stat distributions for 2025. Her defense (1260) and health (2012) are incredibly robust, allowing her to survive long enough to charge her Slow mana. Compared to modern benchmarks, she is essentially a tank disguised as a sniper. Even un-emblemed, she boasts survivability that older tanks would envy, which is critical for a hero that needs time to charge.
"Hungering Grave" is a skill title that does not lie. This ability is a masterclass in single-target elimination.
800% damage is catastrophic. Most snipers hover around 450-550%. Mortewitch nearly doubles that.

The most critical component. Defensive buffs, counterattacks, and defense-up status effects are completely ignored. If the enemy has a Taunt hero up with a defense buff, Mortewitch hits them as if they were naked.

She heals all allies for 40% of the damage dealt. If she hits a defense-down target for 2000 damage (which is plausible), she heals the entire team for 800 HP. This scales with her Attack stat and the enemy's lack of defense, turning her into a potent healer.
The Grave Mothling Mega Fiend is the cherry on top. It absorbs healing (80% of owner's max HP is a huge shield to chew through), deals constant damage (270% attack), and crucially,
increases damage taken by the target by 50%
. This turns the victim into a piñata for tile damage and other special skills.
Let's break down the math to see why she is terrifying.
Slow. Requires 12 tiles to charge. With a level 29 Magic/Styx troop or a 5-star Master troop, you can shave this down, but she will never be "fast."
Against a modern hero with ~1500 defense, standard damage formula reduction applies, but thanks to the
mechanic, this number isn't mitigated by active buffs. You are looking at hits ranging from
damage depending on troops and board combo bonuses.
This is comparable to a dedicated healer's raw output, but attached to a tactical nuke.
Damage taken +50%: A tile that usually hits for 100 now hits for 150. A follow-up sniper shot that would do 1000 now does 1500.
Family Bonus, Passives, Aether Power & Unique Abilities
The Moth family brings a unique control mechanic that pairs deviously with Mortewitch's slow speed.

The Moth family bonus (Moth Dust) is a passive control tool. When an enemy casts a Special Skill, there is a chance (50%/75%/100% depending on team size) they get hit with Moth Dust. After 3 turns, this explodes into heavy damage and sleep. While Mortewitch is charging, this passive can disrupt the enemy rhythm, potentially buying her the time she needs. Note that safe cleansing removes the dust but triggers the family effect damage/sleep immediately in some interactions (as noted by community testing), or speeds up the timer.

A 15% chance to dodge damage from Special Skills. It is a low percentage, but on a Slow hero, any mitigation helps. When it procs, it can be the difference between firing her skill or dying with a full mana bar.
At the start of battle, defense is increased for 6 turns. This is perfect for a Slow hero, helping her survive the initial barrage of Fast snipers while she gathers tiles.

Released in early 2025, Mortewitch arrived at a time when health pools were exploding, and players needed ways to punch through overhealed, high-defense teams. While the "Slow" label often scares players away, Mortewitch found a niche immediately as a "problem solver" for Rush wars and a Titan staple.

Even nearly a year later, 800% damage with Bypass is not common. Power creep has increased stats, but the mechanical purity of "ignores defense buffs" keeps her relevant. Her stats (especially LB2) hold up well against the latest releases. The Mega Fiend mechanic remains one of the strongest anti-heal/damage-amp tools available.

In Very Fast wars and tournaments, she is a top-tier threat. In standard PvP, she requires support (mana boosters or taunt heroes) to work effectively, but the payoff is often a guaranteed kill. She has not been relegated to the bench; she simply requires a team built to let her fire.
As a Sorcerer, Mortewitch has an interesting grid. Given her role, there are two distinct schools of thought.
Focus on Shield and Health nodes.
She is Slow. She needs to survive tile damage and slashes to fire. If she dies before charging, she does 0 damage. This build maximizes her consistency.
Her healing is based on damage dealt. Lower attack means slightly lower healing numbers.
Maximizes the 800% multiplier. A higher Attack stat means a harder hit, which means a bigger heal for the team. This leans into her "one-shot" identity.
Slightly riskier if she gets focused down early.

path is recommended. Her base defensive stats are already tank-level high (1260 def / 2012 HP). She is sturdy enough to take a few hits. Maximizing her Attack stat leverages her unique damage-to-heal conversion and ensures that when she
fire, the target is absolutely deleted.
Makes her immune to the frustrations of Counterattack (Cyprian, Obakan) and Defense Up.
800% is often a One-Hit Kill (OHK) or close to it.
The Mega Fiend increases all incoming damage by 50%, ensuring the target falls quickly if the skill doesn't kill them instantly.
Acts as both a sniper and a team healer.
Her biggest Achilles' heel. She can be dead before she moves in bad board scenarios.
While she heals everyone, she only removes one threat. In minion-heavy or swarm metas, she might kill one enemy while the other four overrun you.
Mana cuts or stops (like from Proteus or Hel) shut her down completely.
She is a monster in Very Fast modes. 6 tiles to deal 800% damage is unfair.
The Mega Fiend's +50% damage intake debuff is incredible for high Titan scores. Note: It generally overwrites other specific damage-taken debuffs (like Gastille), so manage your team carefully.
Great for nuking high-HP bosses that rely on defensive buffs.
help mitigate her Slow speed. Ludwig next to Mortewitch allows her to fire repeatedly, which is game over.
can buy her the time she needs to charge.
While her Fiend overwrites some damage amplifiers, she pairs well with heroes that apply defense down (standard) or elemental defense down (EDD).
C. G. Panther - Mortewitch - Ludwig - Bastet - Araminta
Use Panther for EDD, Ludwig to charge Mortewitch, and Mortewitch to delete key threats one by one.
Flank or Tank position. In Rush, she fires quickly, heals the team, and leaves a nasty fiend.
. The community notes that the Mega Fiend's damage amplification debuff is undispellable and overwrites Gastille's debuff. They do not stack. However, she
stack with stack-based damage increases like
Since she is single target, if the enemy dodges (C. Kadilen), her turn is wasted.
While she bypasses defense buffs, she still hits the Taunter. She will likely kill the Taunter, but it saves the rest of the team.

If you pulled Mortewitch early, congratulations. She will carry you through map stages and destroy bosses effortlessly. Focus on keeping her alive with potions or healers. Do not worry about her speed; in lower-level raids, you often have time to charge her.

Mortewitch is a luxury tool for solving specific problems—namely, ultra-tanky heroes on Rush defense or pushing Titan scores. She is worth the Limit Break mats if you lack a reliable heavy hitter for Purple. However, if you already have a deep roster of Fast purples, you might find her too sluggish for standard raiding unless paired with Ludwig.
The community reaction to Mortewitch was initially skeptical due to the "Slow" tag, but quickly turned into awe upon seeing her damage numbers.
Users quickly identified her as a "Titan hero" due to the permanent +50% damage received from the fiend. "It took my Titan scores to the next level," said one player.
One user perfectly summarized her playstyle:
"In that sense, Mortewitch is a true sniper — taking her time to line up her shot, but with devastating results... a purple moth incarnation of freaking Simo Häyhä."

There was debate about her tanking. While some found success in Rush wars ("She killed 3 of my cards before I could take her down"), others noted that in standard formations, she is "farmed for one shots." The consensus settles on her being a devastating Flank or a Rush Tank.
A key discovery by players was the interaction with Gastille:
"No, zarga and gastille, or zarga and mortewitch can be active at the same time, but not gastille and mortewitch."

Mortewitch is the definition of "high risk, high reward," except the risk is just waiting a few extra turns, and the reward is the total obliteration of an enemy hero. She brings a refreshing, heavy-hitting playstyle to the Dark element that doesn't rely on complex status ailment stacks or minion spam—just brute force and hungry moths. While speed demons may dominate the leaderboard, Mortewitch reminds us that death, while sometimes slow, is inevitable.
A titan-slaying, rush-war-dominating powerhouse that remains relevant simply because 800% damage never goes out of style.
